column1: Hirluin the Fair or Hirluin of the Green Hills was the leader of the people of the Green Hills of Gondor during the War of the Ring.
He was one of the many leaders of Men who brought companies to Minas Tirith; in his contingent were three hundred gallant green-clad men.  A week later
column2: he fought in the Battle of the Pelennor Fields
column3: rushing to the aid of Éomer and the Rohirrim
column4: in the van with Imrahil of Dol Amroth
column5: Húrin (Warden of the Keys) and Forlong.  He was slain on the fields before the City.

column1: The name Hirluin is composed of the two elements hîr "lord" and luin "pale
